channel.title: Funny question&responce in the Andrew Gower Q&A
channel.description:
?:
In your opinion, do you think RuneScape will ever surpass it's current engine limitations, like having our characters walk in a grid, or having the game run in 600 millisecond 'ticks'? Do you have any more advanced graphic features planned (bloom, Depth of Field, etc)? Do you think we'll ever have the ability to control our characters with the keyboard, like some other MMO's?
Andrew Gower:
Have you been spying on us? Are you one of our staff in disguise? :P These questions are remarkably similar to questions we have been asking ourselves internally. To answer your questions: maybe, yes and yes.

item.description:

item.title: Funny question&responce in the Andrew Gower Q&A
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:28, topic:305635”][quote author=Nueb35 link=topic=401864.msg2983725#msg2983725 date=1254796226]

The title header bar is implementation defined; you’ll see you can create undecorated windows in java

[code]import javax.swing.*;

public class Undecored {

public static void main(String[] argv) {
    JFrame jf = new JFrame("dix");
    jf.setSize(300, 300);
    jf.setUndecorated(true);
    jf.setVisible(true);
}

}[/code]

[/quote]ya but then thats just nasty imo, and you’d have to implement your own method of moving the window (ie have a mouse event listener on the frame and upon click, make the window follow the mouse until mouse releases event)

JFrame.setDefaultLookAndFeelDecorated

it supports window moving? why make your own?

read the thread idiot

@super if u want an undecorated frame… why not just use a jwindow?[/quote]

Ignore Nueb35 he’s just stupid.
Anyway, I’m just showing that title bar is implementation defined and isn’t needed, so why should java keep track of mouse events on it?

Read full topic

He answered: ‘maybe’, ‘yes’, and ‘yes’. Why don’t you fuck off back to your little hole before i smash 7 bottles over your head.
[center] If you can’t respond in a civil manner, don’t respond at all.[/center]

item.title: Funny question&responce in the Andrew Gower Q&A
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

Mopman:

then he was just bullshitting, cuz that would make no sense

In your opinion, do you think RuneScape will ever surpass it's current engine limitations, like having our characters walk in a grid, or having the game run in 600 millisecond 'ticks'? Do you have any more advanced graphic features planned (bloom, Depth of Field, etc)? Do you think we'll ever have the ability to control our characters with the keyboard, like some other MMO's?

Three questions:

  1. Do you think RuneScape will ever surpass its current engine limitations (for example, characters walking in a grid, or having the game run in 600 ms ticks)?
  2. Any more advanced graphic features planned (for example, bloom, Depth of Field, etc.)?
  3. Will we ever have the ability to control our character with the keyboard (for example, some other MMO’s)?

Seemed pretty easy to see to me. He just liked including examples with each of his questions. It does make sense, he just happened to use the word ‘like’ instead of pharses such as ‘for example’ or ‘i.e.’

Read full topic

item.title: Funny question&responce in the Andrew Gower Q&A
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

a few months ago, while i was making my pokemon client in java, in which the walking is done through arrow keys, i realized that there is a downside, which may appear as a bug, but isnt. it also happens in the current runescape client with the ‘map rotation’. if you load the runescape client through a frame (ie using main(), or a loader, etc), login, hit any arrow key and leave it pressed then click the window title bar (while still pressing the arrow key), then release the arrow key, and release the click, the client will keep on spinning as if you were holding the arrow key. that is because java has no control over the window’s title bar, and does not receive events from it. therefore, if they implement walking in it, this will also happen (as it did in my pokemon). even though it is not a bug, it sure seems like one, and i find it annoying

Read full topic
item.source: Funny question&responce in the Andrew Gower Q&A
